pr_title: FM2-225:Add buildDelete static method for FhirProviderUtils

timeline.body:
Depending on the server outcome, IssueSeverity can be either `ERROR, FATAL, WARNING `or `INFORMATION`. So this should be dynamic.
More information about OperationOutcome [here](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/operationoutcome.html)
timeline.bodyText:
Depending on the server outcome, IssueSeverity can be either ERROR, FATAL, WARNING or INFORMATION. So this should be dynamic.

replies.bodyText: Thanks for clarifying about this, Anything to respond about my code above
replies.author: sherrif10

timeline.body: i set issueSeverity.ERROR  as it should be supposed to be
timeline.bodyText: i set issueSeverity.ERROR  as it should be supposed to be
timeline.bodyHTML: i set issueSeverity.ERROR as it should be supposed to be
timeline.author: sherrif10

replies.bodyText: @sherrif10 Actually, this should be `IssueSeverity.INFORMATION, because we're sending a result that says the object was successfully deleted. No error occurred. I've made that change.
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: Thanks for replying @ibacher , Wont we need to call these errors as variables, i mean something like public static string INFORMATION="A message that the server will send";. this is my idea however, or we just define the extension of issueSeverity and the server knows the what to send!
replies.author: sherrif10

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
public static OperationOutcome buildDelete(OperationOutcome.IssueSeverity code, OperationOutcome.IssueType issueType,
BaseServerResponseException exception) {
//created codeable concepts to be called by operationOutcome, codeableconcept only limited to two properties text and coding
CodeableConcept codeableConcept = new CodeableConcept().setText("MSG_DELETED").setText("informational")
.setText("This resource has been deleted").setText("informational")
.setText("http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/operation-outcome").setText("This resource has been deleted")
.setText(exception.getMessage());
OperationOutcome operationOutcome = new OperationOutcome();
operationOutcome.addIssue().setSeverity(OperationOutcome.IssueSeverity.INFORMATION).setCode(issueType)
.setDetails(codeableConcept);// am assumming setting details will trigger only called codeableconcepts above
exception.setOperationOutcome(operationOutcome);
return operationOutcome;
}
public static OperationOutcome buildDelete(DomainResource resource) {
OperationOutcome outcome = new OperationOutcome();
outcome.addIssue().setSeverity(OperationOutcome.IssueSeverity.INFORMATION)
.setCode(OperationOutcome.IssueType.INFORMATIONAL).setDetails(MSG_DELETED);
return outcome;
}

With MSG_DELETED defined like this:

private static final CodeableConcept MSG_DELETED = new CodeableConcept();

static {
	MSG_DELETED.addCoding().setSystem("http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/operation-outcome")
			.setCode("MSG_DELETED").setDisplay("This resource has been deleted");
	MSG_DELETED.setText("This resource has been deleted");
}
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: I  didnot add private access modifier since it triggered me to make MSG_DELETED  defined as a constant
replies.author: sherrif10
